messages.messageBody:
May 8
LA Times : Staying Home to Go to School
http://www.latimes.com/news/state/20010508/t000038804.html
"Academic reasons, not religious, are often cited for the dramatic increase
in parent-taught students. Even public districts are now helping out."

LA Times : Home-Schooling Takes a Tack Toward Mainstream Parents
http://www.latimes.com:80/editions/orange/calendar/20010508/t000038650.html
"Education: 'New breed of family' is interested more in quality education
than religious or political dogma, experts say." (similar beginning, but
different content in these two articles)

Chicago Sun-Times : 6 whiz kids attest: Parents know best
http://www.suntimes.com/output/news/pac08.html
Story of the Pacold family's tremendous success.

Charlotte Observer : Free home-school workshop open to parents in Gaston area
http://www.charlotte.com/observer/local/gaston/pub/library0508.htm
A local library, along with area homeschooling groups, is sponsoring a
homeschool information workshop.

May 6
The Gleaner : This family that plays together...
http://www.thegleaner.com/daily/2001-05-06/news1.html
...in this case also works, travels and learns together. About a traveling
homeschool family whose business is installing playground equipment.

The Star (Malaysia) : Opting out of the system
http://www.thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2001/5/6/education/06lakah1&sec

=education
Noting the growing practice of homeschooling in Malaysia, this article covers
various homeschooling styles and reasons for homeschooling, including quotes
from and/or mentions of Holt, Dobson, Griffith and others.

The Star : An unrealistic environment?
http://www.thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2001/5/6/education/06lakah2&sec

=education
The Education Ministry's perspective. Addresses legal, social and financial
issues of homeschooling in Malaysia.

The Star : Just a regular school day
http://www.thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2001/5/6/education/06kamike1&se

c=education
A typical homeschooling day for the Sanjeevi family.

The Star : Home as a resource centre
http://www.thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2001/5/6/education/06lakah3&sec

=education
"OFFERING students the opportunity of pursuing an alternative education is
what the learning centre run by Kairos Resources aims to do."

Laura Derrick
National Home Education Network

Permission is granted to forward or repost this digest or any links included
in it.

We try to pass along every news article in which homeschooling is mentioned,
without censoring, including negative articles or unfortunate bits written
about or associated with homeschooling. If you are offended by an article,
or if you especially like an article, we encourage you to write the editor
with your comments.
